intro: Diplusodon glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-green spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small and greenish-yellow, often grouped in clusters, and are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
